context: The <a0_0><b5_0>25,000<b5_0/><a0_0/> cotton growers in the United States of America are heavily subsidized at the rate of <a1_0><b6_0>$2 billion per year<b6_0/><a1_0/> although <a2_0><b7_0>China<b7_0/><a2_0/> now provides the highest overall level of cotton sector support. The future of these subsidies is uncertain and has led to anticipatory expansion of cotton brokers' operations in Africa. Dunavant expanded in Africa by buying out local operations. This is only possible in <a4_0><b9_0>former British colonies<b9_0/><a4_0/> and Mozambique; former <a3_0><b8_0>French<b8_0/><a3_0/> colonies continue to maintain tight monopolies, inherited from their former colonialist masters, on cotton purchases at low fixed prices.
